block.p: BET.com, a Web site created in February as adjunct to the Black Entertainment Television cable network, has reached a tentative agreement to buy a key competitor, 360HIPHOP.com. That Web site, started in June by Russell Simmons, the founder of Def Jam Records, is geared to music trends and information. Under the agreement, the two companies will combine business operations, but maintain separate Web sites. BET.com is ranked among the most popular African-American-oriented sites on the Internet.
